Python Zen

The Zen of Python

Beautiful is better than ugly.

Explicit is better than implicit.

Simple is better than complex.

Complex is better than complicated.

Flat is better than nested.

Sparse is better than dense.

Readability counts.

Features of Python

About Python

Python is a simple and minimalistic language. Reading a good Python program feels almost like reading English, although very strict English! This pseudo-code nature of Python is one of its greatest strengths. It allows you to concentrate on the solution to the problem rather than the language itself. As you will see, Python is extremely easy to get started with. Python has an extraordinarily simple syntax, as already mentioned. When you write programs in Python, you never need to bother about the low-level details such as managing the memory used by your program, etc. You can embed Python within your C/C++ programs to give scripting capabilities for your program's users.

Learn more »
